features: Durable Cast Iron Construction: Made from heavy-duty cast iron for long-lasting use and even heat distribution.
Set of 3 Skillets: Includes 12 inch and 10.25 inch skillets for versatile cooking.
Compatible with Gas Stovetops: Designed to work seamlessly on gas stovetops for easy cooking.
Oven Safe: Can be used in the oven for baking, roasting and more.
Easy to Clean: Hand wash only for quick and simple cleaning.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: LODGE 12” + 10.25” + 8” CAST IRON SKILLET SET For over 100 years Lodge has been dedicated to manufacturing quality cookware, that can be passed down from one generation to the next. From summertime campouts to Sunday night dinners, Lodge is happy to be at home on your table. Product at a Glance: The right tool to sear, sauté, bake, broil, braise, fryBrutally tough for decades of cookingSeasoned for a natural, easy-release finish that improves with useUnparalleled in heat retention and even heatingAt home in the oven, on the stove, on the grill or over the campfire

SEASONED & READY TO USE Lodge seasons all of their cookware with vegetable oil before it leaves the foundry, so all you have to do is give it a quick rinse and you’re ready to cook. Seasoning is cooking oil that has been baked onto the iron, forming a natural, easy-release finish for less sticking. The more you use your cast iron, the better your seasoning will become, making your cast iron darker and smoother over time. Lodge products are perfect for everything from baking to braising, frying to roasting. MADE IN THE USA Tucked between the Appalachian Mountains and the Tennessee River you’ll find the small town of South Pittsburg, TN; a town that Lodge is proud to call home. It’s built on family values, American history, and high quality cast iron. All Lodge products are proudly made in the USA, meaning you’ll get the craftsmanship that has been passed down through generations. For over 100 years Lodge has been dedicated to manufacturing quality cast iron products, that can be passed down from one generation to the next. Lodge is happy to be at home on your table. CLEANING & CARE There’s nothing better than a home-cooked meal, and Lodge’s rust-resistant line just made that easier. Items in this line undergo a patented heat-treating process to inhibit rust. Hand washing this pan with warm soapy water is recommended to preserve the cookware’s seasoned finish. For extra stuck-on bits, an occasional trip through the dishwasher is fine, just apply a thin coat of cooking oil to it afterward to maintain the seasoning. Lodge prides itself on high quality and timeless design, which has now been matched with new technology and convenience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best cast iron skillets
reviews.reviewText: Easy to clean and the best I skillets I have used.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Buy them NOW
reviews.reviewText: We should have spent money on these 5 years ago. Instead we tried aaallll the other pans, and then after multiple disappointing dishes & scrubbing sessions we said eff it, let's get cast iron. Best decision! These are awesome quality & the perfect sizes. Easy to clean (read how to do it) and nothing sticks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You should still season them
reviews.reviewText: They work great. Good price especially for USA made. But you should still season them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful to use
reviews.reviewText: Great to use, easy clean, only use them a few times can’t wait to make more stuff in these pans

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beats other pans hands down.
reviews.reviewText: Solid, beautifully designed and produced. Nothing beats the quality of frying in a cast iron skillet. However, must be attentive to proper cleaning and re-oiling after use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Prone to rust and difficult to clean, but it is cast iron through-and-through
reviews.reviewText: These are very rugged and solid. Proper seasoning and cleaning will keep them going forever. But they're extremely prone to rust (I can already see some developing on the bottom of mine) and due to their nature hard to clean, you can't just toss them in a dishwasher. Otherwise great cookware which has the potential to last forever.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love these. Great value for your money. Will last forever

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These skillets will last forever!
reviews.reviewText: I was raised with a cast iron skillet on the stove top. We prepared most of our meals in this one skillet. It really takes a while to truly season this type of skillet. My husband was low on iron which was the initial reason for my purchase. The second reason is that I have had numerous Teflon coated products over the years and none last. Stainless steel will not give you the iron supplement that these skillets do.

I've rated the 'Easy to clean' as a four of five, only because it' a cast iron and extra care is needed to keep it in good condition. I also rated 2 of 5 for 'Heat resistance' only because the pan heats up very well and you need oven mits to handle when it's hot. Great product to have for health benefits with iron content; don't need iron supplements. I'm very happy with these lodge pre-season pans.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: For years I’ve considered buying cast iron pans because non-stick coating goes after a while. Wish I’d done it before. Worth buying silicon handle and rim holders.

reviews.reviewTitle: El paquete en su interior muy mal
reviews.reviewText: El producto es bueno sólo que uno de los sartenes llego fracturado del mango y lo voy a regresar para el reembolso

reviews.reviewTitle: Top Pfannen - keep in the family
reviews.reviewText: Vorab- ich habe die Pfannen gekauft und ich bekomme kein Geld für Rezensionen...Ich hatte drei verschiede Guss-Pfannen gekauft um zu testen was wirklich gut ist- weil ich weg von komischen Beschichtungen wollte- also habe ich Burnhart und Petromax gegen Lodge antreten lassen- Fazit: alle gut aber... erst mal sind meine drei Lodge Pfannen für zwei Wochen im Zoll in Köln stecken geblieben - Jross noch Kölle ... dann waren sie hier- leider offensichtlich mehrfach geöffnet - und etwas nachlässig wieder eingepackt- hey - es sind nur Pfannen... ich habe eine Lodge gleich eingesetzt - Fehler- und dann schrubben. Pre- seasoned nennen die das aber besser ist es die Pfannen noch mal einzubrennen (einreiben mit Pflanzenöl und im Grill oder Ofen bei 200 für eine Stunde einbrennen). Ansonsten bin ich jetzt happy mit den Pfannen- sie werden immer besser. Mir ist aufgefallen dass die kleinste Pfanne eine etwas grobere Oberfläche hat. Ansonsten hat bei mir Lodge klar gewonnen. Am besten zu reinigen! Es sei denn man vergleicht mit Staub aus dem Elsass... aber das ist eine andere Geschichte und eine andere Preisklasse.

reviews.reviewTitle: BEST VALUE & by far better than any Le Creuset Skillet.
reviews.reviewText: These are my favourite skillets EVER!ROBUSTHEALTHYHEATS UP FASTNON STICKGREAT PRICEI recommend you try these pans out. These will last a few generations. I bought a 10.25 inch last year and have used it everyday, a few times a day, ever since I got them. Love it so much that I kept an eye out for this set because I needed the 12 inch/30cm pan and it was a fantastic price on Amazon. $120.83AUD delivered! Of course at that price I had to buy 2 sets!I love my Le Creuset Dutch ovens and I also have the Le Creuset 10.25 inch/26cm skillet however as soon as I got my first Lodge 10.25 inch skillet I have never looked back. With Lodge you can be really rough with it.I caramelise onions in a jiffy, create nice crusts on steaks, brown mince in no time, cook the perfect eggs, the list is endless. The reason why I prefer my Lodge Skillet over my Le Creuset Skillet is the heat up time (Le Creuset takes a much longer time to heat) plus there's a HUGE difference in price.
